meanings.definition: A polite form of address to a married woman.
meanings.sent1: The kind bemadam greeted us warmly at the event.
meanings.sent2: She smiled at the bemadam as she entered the room.
meanings.sent3: The bemadam at the store complimented my outfit.
meanings.sent4: The bemadam of the house welcomed us with open arms.
meanings.sent5: I always feel respected when someone calls me bemadam.

meanings.definition: To address or refer to a woman as 'madam'.
meanings.sent1: Please bemadam the guest when she arrives.
meanings.sent2: He bemadamed her when asking for directions.
meanings.sent3: The children bemadam their teacher playfully.
meanings.sent4: She bemadamed her friend to show respect.
meanings.sent5: Remember to bemadam the lady at the front desk.
